glsa.title: PuTTY: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in PuTTY might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service.

background.p: PuTTY is a free implementation of Telnet and SSH for Windows and Unix platforms, along with an xterm terminal emulator.

description.p: A heap-corrupting buffer overflow bug in the ssh_agent_channel_data function of PuTTY was found.

impact.p: A remote attacker, utilizing the SSH agent forwarding of an SSH server, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the client or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
